main event: On March 27, 1966, multiple witnesses in Henniker, New Hampshire observed four unidentified objects in the sky for a duration of six hours.
interesting points: The objects were reported to appear as bright lights in bluish green, red, and yellow colors,The observer described one object as having a definite oblong or elliptical shape and noted its buzzing noise,There were approximately 100 witnesses, including students from New England College, who viewed the objects together,The sighting included details about the position of planets and stars in the night sky at the time of the observation,The objects disappeared and reappeared during the observation, creating an impression of fading in and out.
